tool.name: OTB.GeneratePlyFile
tool.description: Generate a 3D Ply file from a DEM and a color image.
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayindem False isArrayincolor False output_data_out $output_data_out name OTB.GeneratePlyFile indem $indem mode $mode map $map map.utm.zone $map.utm.zone map.utm.northhem $map.utm.northhem map.epsg.code $map.epsg.code incolor $incolor prefer $prefer response $response outputType_out $OutputSection_out.outputType_out transmissionMode_out $OutputSection_out.transmissionMode_out

param.name: indem
param.label: The image should be either a projected DEM or a 3D grid containing 3D point coordinates and a validity mask.
param.help: The image should be either a projected DEM or a 3D grid containing 3D point coordinates and a validity mask. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: png, jpeg, tiff

param.name: map
param.label: Defines the map projection to be used.
param.help: Defines the map projection to be used.

param.name: map.utm.zone
param.label: The zone number ranges from 1 to 60 and allows defining the transverse mercator projection (along with the hemisphere)
param.help: The zone number ranges from 1 to 60 and allows defining the transverse mercator projection (along with the hemisphere)

param.name: map.utm.northhem
param.label: The transverse mercator projections are defined by their zone number as well as the hemisphere. Activate this parameter if your image is in the northern hemisphere.
param.help: The transverse mercator projections are defined by their zone number as well as the hemisphere. Activate this parameter if your image is in the northern hemisphere.

param.name: map.epsg.code
param.label: See www.spatialreference.org to find which EPSG code is associated to your projection
param.help: See www.spatialreference.org to find which EPSG code is associated to your projection

param.name: incolor
param.label: If the color image has 4 bands it will be interpreted as Red, Green, Blue, NIR. In other cases, only the first one is used (gray scale colors). The color values are expected in the range 0 - 255, and will be embedded with each 3D point of the PLY file.
param.help: If the color image has 4 bands it will be interpreted as Red, Green, Blue, NIR. In other cases, only the first one is used (gray scale colors). The color values are expected in the range 0 - 255, and will be embedded with each 3D point of the PLY file. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: png, jpeg, tiff

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_out
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_out
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: The application converts an image containing elevations into a PLY file, which is a file format to store 3D models. This format is adpated for visualization on software such as MeshLab [2] or CloudCompare [3]This application is part of the stereo reconstruction framework. The input data can be produced by the application DisparityMapToElevationMap.There are two types of supported input images: * A DEM image, with a ground projection, containing elevation values. Each elevation value can be considered as a 3D point. * A 3D grid image, containing 5 bands (the first 3 are the 3D coordinates of each point, the 5th is a validity mask where valid values are larger or equal to 1)The user shall also give a support image that contains color values for each 3D point. The color values will be embedded in the PLY file.
